definitions: long piece of fabric worn around the neck or head for warmth or decoration
woodworking joint where two pieces overlap and connect together securely
examples: She wrapped a woolen scarf around her neck
The colorful scarf matched her winter coat perfectly
The carpenter used a scarf joint for the beam
Learning to cut scarf joints takes considerable practice

definitions: vivid red color with a slight orange tint often associated with intensity or passion
examples: The cardinal wore traditional scarlet robes
She painted the door a brilliant scarlet shade

definitions: steep natural slope or cliff formed by erosion or earth movement
examples: The earthquake created a dramatic scarp along the fault
We carefully climbed down the rocky scarp

definitions: animal feces used for tracking or scientific study
improvisational jazz singing using nonsense syllables instead of words
examples: The ranger identified bear scat on the trail
Scientists analyze scat to study animal diets
Ella Fitzgerald was famous for her scat singing
The vocalist improvised a brilliant scat solo

definitions: act of spreading things over a wide area or the pattern created by dispersed objects
examples: The scattering of seeds helps plants spread naturally
Light scattering creates the blue color of sky

definitions: animal or person that searches for and collects discarded items or feeds on dead matter
examples: Vultures are important scavengers in many ecosystems
The scavenger collected bottles for recycling money

definitions: natural features of a landscape considered for their visual appeal
painted backdrops and stage decorations used in theatrical productions
examples: The mountain scenery took our breath away
We stopped frequently to photograph the coastal scenery
The crew changed the scenery between acts
The elaborate scenery enhanced the dramatic performance

definitions: distinctive smell or odor that can be pleasant or used for tracking
examples: The scent of roses filled the garden
Dogs can follow a scent trail for miles

definitions: ornamental rod carried by rulers as a symbol of sovereign power and authority
examples: The king held the golden scepter during coronation
Ancient Egyptian pharaohs carried scepters as power symbols

definitions: attitude of doubt or questioning approach toward claims, beliefs, or apparent facts requiring evidence
examples: Scientific scepticism helps distinguish fact from fiction
Her scepticism about the investment proved well-founded

definitions: ornamental rod carried by rulers as a symbol of sovereign power and authority
examples: The queen's sceptre sparkled with precious gems
The sceptre has been passed through generations

definitions: person or computer program that organizes tasks, appointments, or resources according to time
examples: The production scheduler optimized factory workflow efficiently
My digital scheduler reminds me of upcoming meetings

definitions: process of planning and organizing activities, resources, or events according to available time
examples: Scheduling employee shifts requires careful coordination
The scheduling of classes avoids time conflicts

definitions: organized plan, outline, or framework that represents the structure of something complex
examples: The database schema defines how data is organized
Children develop cognitive schemas through learning experiences

definitions: simplified diagram showing the arrangement and connections of parts in a system
examples: The engineer studied the circuit schematic carefully
This schematic illustrates how components connect together

definitions: playful, light musical movement typically the third part of a symphony or sonata
examples: Beethoven's scherzo movements display remarkable energy
The pianist performed the scherzo with delightful precision

definitions: former monetary unit used in Austria and other European countries before the euro
examples: My grandfather still remembers prices in schillings
The old schilling coins became collectors' items

definitions: formal division within a religious organization or any group caused by disagreement over fundamental beliefs
examples: The schism divided the church into separate factions
Political schisms often weaken party unity significantly

definitions: person with or relating to a personality pattern characterized by emotional detachment and solitary behavior
examples: The schizoid personality avoids close emotional connections
His schizoid tendencies made social interaction difficult

definitions: chronic brain disorder affecting thought, perception, and behavior, often involving delusions and hallucinations
examples: Schizophrenia typically emerges in late adolescence
Modern treatments help many people with schizophrenia

definitions: person diagnosed with schizophrenia or something characterized by contradictory or conflicting elements
examples: The schizophrenic patient responded well to medication
Critics called the policy approach completely schizophrenic

definitions: excessive sentimentality in art or music, originally rendered chicken fat in Jewish cooking
examples: The movie was criticized for its schmaltz
Some enjoy schmaltz while others find it cloying

definitions: relating to schools, education, or scholarly achievement in academic pursuits
examples: Her scholastic achievements earned multiple scholarship offers
The scholastic aptitude test measures academic readiness

definitions: medieval philosophical and theological system combining religious doctrine with Aristotelian logic and reasoning
examples: Scholasticism dominated European universities for centuries
Thomas Aquinas was a major figure in scholasticism

definitions: boy who attends school, typically elementary or secondary level
examples: The schoolboy carried his books in a backpack
Schoolboy pranks often test teachers' patience

definitions: girl who attends school, typically elementary or secondary level
examples: The schoolgirl wore her uniform with pride
A group of schoolgirls walked home together

definitions: building used as a school, especially a small rural school
examples: The old red schoolhouse still stands today
Pioneer children learned in one-room schoolhouses

definitions: education or training received at school or the process of being taught
examples: Her schooling prepared her well for university
The cost of private schooling continues rising

definitions: male teacher, especially one who teaches in or runs a school
examples: The strict schoolmaster maintained classroom discipline
Victorian schoolmasters often used corporal punishment

definitions: person who attends or attended the same school as another
examples: She reconnected with old schoolmates at the reunion
My schoolmate helped me understand the assignment

definitions: room in a school building where lessons are taught
examples: The schoolroom walls displayed student artwork
They arranged desks in the schoolroom differently

definitions: person who teaches students in a school, typically elementary or secondary level
examples: The dedicated schoolteacher inspired countless students
Many schoolteachers spend personal funds on supplies

definitions: work assigned to students to complete at school or home
examples: She finished her schoolwork before watching television
Balancing schoolwork and sports requires good planning

definitions: outdoor area of a school where children play during breaks
examples: Children played games in the schoolyard
The schoolyard buzzed with laughter during recess

definitions: sailing ship with two or more masts, with fore-and-aft sails on all masts
examples: The historic schooner sailed into the harbor
Fishing schooners once filled these coastal waters

definitions: short sword with a curved blade that broadens toward the point
examples: The warrior wielded a gleaming scimitar
Middle Eastern armies traditionally used scimitars

definitions: flash of light or sparkle, especially rapid changes in brightness of celestial objects
examples: Star scintillation creates the twinkling effect
The diamond's scintillation caught everyone's attention

definitions: descendant of a notable family or a young shoot of a plant for grafting
examples: The young scion inherited the family business
The gardener grafted a scion onto rootstock

definitions: cutting instrument with two blades pivoted together that cut when brought together
examples: She used scissors to cut the fabric
Keep scissors away from young children

definitions: person who frequently finds fault or criticizes others harshly
examples: The neighborhood scold complained about everything
Don't be such a scold about minor mistakes

definitions: angry rebuke or criticism delivered to someone who has done wrong
examples: The child received a scolding for misbehaving
Her scolding made him realize his mistake

definitions: small British quick bread often containing fruit and served with tea
examples: She enjoyed scones with clotted cream and jam
The bakery sells fresh blueberry scones daily

definitions: deep spoon-like utensil for serving or moving loose material
exclusive news story obtained before competing news organizations
examples: Use the ice cream scoop for uniform portions
One scoop of vanilla, please
The reporter got a major scoop on corruption
Their scoop revealed important financial irregularities

definitions: two-wheeled vehicle propelled by pushing with one foot or by a small motor
examples: Children rode scooters in the neighborhood park
Electric scooters provide convenient urban transportation

definitions: mark or discoloration caused by burning or excessive heat
examples: The iron left a scorch on the shirt
Scorch marks showed where lightning had struck

definitions: large board displaying the score and other information during a game
examples: The scoreboard showed the home team winning
Everyone watched the scoreboard during overtime

definitions: card for recording scores during a game or rating performance
examples: Golfers track strokes on their scorecard
The performance scorecard measured employee productivity
